website_summaries.verdict: To use the Kalita Wave 155 drip brewer properly takes plenty of practice and extra kitchen gear, but the payoff is a cup of fabulously good drip.
pros: If you have the will to practice, the Kalita Wave 155 brews outstanding cups of drip coffee
It's relatively affordable compared with fancy automatic coffee makers
It's made from textured stainless steel that's durable and attractive
cons: To use it properly takes lots of practice and patience
Kitchen appliances such as a quality burr grinder, a scale and a gooseneck kettle will increase your chances for brewing success but you'll have to purchase them separately

customer_reviews.title: Impressive coffee, slow delivery due to customs
customer_reviews.text: The glass Kalita wave dripper is well designed and brews an impressive cup of coffee, but as others have noted, it is surprisingly small by American standards. It's the size of a small cup cake, so you have to pour over water a couple of times to fill a 12 oz mug. It was shipped by airmail from Japan, but it took nearly three months to arrive due to customs (a result of the US trade wars??). I almost gave up but glad it finally arrived.

customer_reviews.title: Not optimal for really fresh coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Hario V60 and the Beehouse drippers prior to using the Kalita Wave 155. I use 26 grams of coffee for my 12 oz cup. The Kalita Wave is barely big enough for that volume is you're using fresh coffee. The pre-wet and bloom pours will come right to the very top, so there is little room for error in that regard. I was skeptical of such a small dripper having 3 holes in the bottom, but using the Kalita spec filters the flow rate was okay and the finished cup pretty good. I would prefer it to be a bit slower and that the brew filter capacity were a bit larger to allow for more bloom.

product_meta.title: Kalita Wave Dripper 155 series glass [1-2 person] # 05045 (japan import) by Kalita (Carita)
product_meta.description: Clarity is beautiful, it is heat-resistant glass dripper.
feature_bullets: Size: holder (flange) / diameter about 105mm, height / about 65mm
Material Material: Main body / heat-resistant glass, holder / polypropylene
THE KALITA WAVE 155 GLASS. The Kalita Wave 155 ideal for brewing 12-16oz of flavorful, full-bodied coffee. Kalita 155 filters are available separately (#22195).

PULLS A GREAT CUP EVERY TIME: The Kalita Wave pour-over coffee set features Kalita's patented wave design that reduces contact between the brewing space and the filter itself for a more balanced extraction and a flavorful, full-bodied cup of coffee every time. The design of the dripper and filter together help create a pool of water on top of the coffee bed that can help control agitation, helping maintain a uniform extraction without too much agitation (which could lead to over-extraction).

PERFECT FOR BEGINNERS AND PROFESSIONALS: You'll find Kalita pour-over products in the world's top specialty cafes and professional coffee-making competitions. But our products are also great for pour-over beginners. Cone drippers and filters require perfect grinds and pouring technique in order to prevent stalling and over-extraction. The wave's flat bottom design, on the other hand, maintains a wide and even coffee bed, allowing water to permeate and leave the dripper evenly through three holes.
